item.title: Noomi Rapace on the Complex, “Punk Rock” Take on Mother Teresa in ‘Mother’: “There Are No Saints”
item.description: The star discusses why she wouldn’t have made the film, premiering in Venice’s Horizons program, with anyone but Teona Strugar Mitevska, the director’s feminist approach, and how the church may react.

item.title: ‘Orphan’: Laszlo Nemes on His “Archetypal” and Very Personal Family Story of 20th Century Traumas
item.description: “It has reverberated so much in my own existence,” the Hungarian auteur shares ahead of the Venice premiere about how his family’s history inspired the film. “It is almost like a Hamlet story.”
